Description: 'Kohl' tube of palm-column form: the body is translucent dark-blue glass. White and yellow chevrons decorate the lower half of the shaft while five white threads in high relief encircle the upper shaft. The flat disc base, outlined in white, extends beyond the shaft. Yellow threads outline the details of the capital while the rim is encircled by a white thread. Thin grey core. Preserved intact. Much of the surface is heavily filmed white. It is supplied with a wooden applicator.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: ‘Masterpieces of Glass, The British Museum’ (London 1968), no. 7; B. Nolte, ‘Die Glasgefässe in Alten Ägypten (Berlin 1968), 145 (with further bibliography), pl. XXXII, 26; 'Un Arte per la Belleza' (Padua, 1984), p. 52 [83] = 'Un Arte per la Bellezza' (Lugano, 1984), p. 49 [102].
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.30, pp.32-33)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
